title: Five Grain Salad
summary: Five Grain Salad is a gluten free and vegetarian recipe with 6 servings. For $3.22 per serving, this recipe covers 27% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains around 23g of protein, 37g of fat, and a total of 887 calories. It works well as a rather expensive main course. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. If you have pepper, wine vinegar, orange segments, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the orange segments you could follow this main course with the Tropical Ambrosia Dessert as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 78%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes include Whole Grain Cranberry Apricot Bars + A Whole Grain Giveaway, Five-grain Salad, and Three-Grain Salad.
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine rice, 1 1/2 cups water, butter and salt and bring to a boil. Stir and cover; reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 50 to 55 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand for 10 minutes covered. Fluff with a fork and adjust seasoning if necessary. Use as desired.Yield: 6 cups (6 servings)Related: Farm to Form by Emeril Lagasse(Image: Steven Freeman/HarperStudio)Show Nutritionhigh-fibervegetariangluten-freewheat-freePer serving, based on6servings.(% daily value)Calories771Fat25.9 g(39.9%)Saturated4.5 g(22.7%)Trans0.1 gCarbs117.2 g(39.1%)Fiber10 g(39.8%)Sugars5.2 gProtein19.1 g(38.2%)Cholesterol5.1 mg(1.7%)Sodium429.7 mg(17.9%)

steps.step: In a medium saucepan, combine rice, 1 1/2 cups water, butter and salt and bring to a boil. Stir and cover; reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 50 to 55 minutes.
Remove from the heat and let stand for 10 minutes covered. Fluff with a fork and adjust seasoning if necessary. Use as desired.
